Ukrainian drones also targeted Gudermes, in Ichkeria, this evening.

@wfwitness

Despite claims by the Russian Ministry of Defence, Vovchansk is not yet fully captured by Russian forces, but it will be soon.
Clashes are continuing on the southeastern outskirts of the city where some pockets of Ukrainian resistance remain. We will likely receive confirmation of the city's capture in the next few days.
As a part of preparations for the upcoming combined missile attack on Ukraine, a Russian Gerbera reconnaissance drone is currently scouting out the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant in Kyiv Oblast.
Over the last month, the total area in Zaporizhzhia Oblast still controlled by Ukraine has decreased by approximately 5.1%.

Dnipropetrovsk Oblast: ~28.90 km¬≤

.

The RUAF entered the settlement
 of 
Novodanilovka
 in the 
Orekhov Direction
. During the 
heavy fog
 across the frontline on 
November 21st
, Russian Forces managed to 
penetrate a BTR 2.5km
 past the line of contact and enter the settlement of 
Novodanilovka
, where an
 infantry component then dismounted
. It is unsure whether all of the dismounted infantry were killed in the subsequent FPV strikes, but it seems with the frontline penetrated even 
more Russian Assault Squads were able to gain a foothold
 on the southern area of the settlement. In 
Malaya Tokmachka
, the settlement remains a 
massive grey-zone
 due to the immense defenses presented by the AFU, however the 
RUAF succeeded in capturing the brick factory
. A 
Russian Soldier was geolocated surrendering

confirming fluid positions
 as there are Ukrainian geolocations in the eastern part of the settlement as well.

Fighterbomber reported that the most recent attack on a Russian tanker off the coast of Turkey was by a Ukrainian USV.

Russian forces have captured the village of Dobropillya, Hulyaipole direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~440.
Total land area: ~2.59 km¬≤.
The fighting for Dobropillya lasted approximately 5 days.
Russian Geran-2 drone strike on a Ukrainian mobile anti-air unit on the Pavlohrad - Dnipro Highway in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.

The Ukrainian 425th Separate Assault Regiment "Skala" published an AI-generated video to their Twitter profile claiming to show Ukrainian soldiers raising a flag in central Pokrovsk. 
The footage was debunked by Deepstate, who showed how the pedestrian crossing sign in the background began to "dance". 
Skala has since deleted the video.

Ukrainian forces have re-established control over the village of Sobolivka, Kupyansk direction, Kharkiv Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~88.
Total land area: ~0.48 km¬≤.
While there were no major battles for Sobolivka, the village has remained in the grey zone for over 3 months.

Kupyansk was also clarified. The situation could soon reach a critical point for Russian formations in the western part of the city.
I will publish a full update on it tomorrow.

The Ukrainian command has sent reinforcements to Vovchansk, in order to save the city from falling.  The immediate goal of the recent Russian advances in Vovchansk is to help tie down Ukrainian units and distract from operations in Kupyansk.   The longer-term‚Ä¶

These reinforcements I 
reported on
 last week were not sent to Vovchansk, but instead to the Lyman - Vilcha area, southwest of the city where Russia has been making significant progress recently.

Drone Strikes, U.S.- Russia Talks: Why Europe Resists Peace?
Overnight on December 2, Russian and Ukrainian forces continued exchanging strikes. The Ukrainian Air Force reported an attack by 62 Russian strike unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), of which 39 were intercepted, according to their data. The Russian Ministry of Defense, in turn, stated that over the past 24 hours, it had destroyed 45 Ukrainian drones over several regions, including Bryansk, Volgograd, Rostov Regions, Krasnodar Krai, and Crimea.
Against this backdrop, a meeting is scheduled today, December 2, in the Kremlin between Russian President Vladimir Putin and¬†U.S. President's Special Envoy, Steve Witkoff, and Jared Kushner. The White House stated that Whitcoff is bringing a "refined" peace plan for Ukraine to Moscow, initially presented by the Donald Trump administration. According to media reports, the document has been shortened from the original 28 to 21 or even 19 points. 
üëâ

Overnight on December 2, Russian and Ukrainian forces continued exchanging strikes. The Ukrainian Air Force reported an attack by 62 Russian strike unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), of which 39 were intercepted, according to their data. The Russian Ministry of Defense, in turn, stated that over the past 24 hours, it had destroyed 45 Ukrainian drones over several regions, including Bryansk, Volgograd, Rostov Regions, Krasnodar Krai, and Crimea.
Against this backdrop, a meeting is scheduled today, December 2, in the Kremlin between Russian President Vladimir Putin and¬†U.S. President's Special Envoy, Steve Witkoff, and Jared Kushner. According to media reports, the document has been shortened from the original 28 to 21 or even 19 points.

Trump Warns Israel Not To Escalate Against Syria In Bizarre Turn Of Events 
United States President Donald Trump warned Israel on December 1 against destabilizing Syria and its new Islamist-led government.
The warning came just three days after a clash in the south of the war-torn country that left 20 Syrians dead and six Israeli troops wounded. Israel said that its troops were on a mission to arrest suspects from a ‚Äúterror group‚Äù. Later, Hebrew media reported that the involvement of the Syrian intelligence was suspected.
‚ÄúIt is very important that Israel maintain a strong and true dialogue with Syria, and that nothing takes place that will interfere with Syria‚Äôs evolution into a prosperous State,‚Äù Trump wrote on his Truth Social platform.
Trump went on to stress that he was ‚Äúvery satisfied‚Äù with Syria‚Äôs current performance under President Ahmed al-Sharaa, who made a historic visit to the White House in November.

Ukraine Inches Closer To Defeat In Huliaipole With Loss Of Two Nearby Towns (Videos)
On December 2, the Russian military captured more settlements close to Huliaipole in Zaporozhye, mounting more pressure on remaining Ukrainian defenses around the key city.
The capture of Zelyony Gai, located to the east of Huliaipole, and Dobropillya, located along the Haichur River to the north of the city, by the Vostok [East] Group of Forces was announced by the Russian Ministry of Defense.
Just a day earlier, presidential press secretary Dmitry Peskov announced that President Vladimir Putin was informed during a visit to a frontline command center on November 30 that the operation to ‚Äúliberate‚Äù Huliaipole had begun, with street fighting already underway inside the city.

Did Sinwar's Hamas Support Assad's Syria? Yes, And It's No Secret
Recently, the Internet has been discussing a Zionist information leak regarding the relationship between the late Yahya Sinwar and Bashar al-Assad.
The Zionists claim to have seized documents¬†belonging to Shahid Sinwar, which contain a plan to "officially return Hamas to the Axis of Resistance." Time will tell whether these are genuine documents from the late Hamas leader or another Zionist hoax, but what's more important now is what purpose the ‚ÄúIsraelis‚Äù are pursuing by publishing these documents. Several options are possible.
Due to the global information propaganda that has been exploiting Syria for all these years, it is generally accepted that Hamas has some "allies" within the current dictatorship in Damascus. This isn't a matter of ideology, but rather a shared Sunni madhhab among most Hamas members and some officials of the al-Julani regime.

Russian Army Advances In Key Areas Near Kostiantynivka And Siversk (Videos)
On December 2, the Russian military‚Äôs Yug [South] Group of Forces advanced in the southern part of the city of Kostiantynivka, and made gains to the south of the city of Siversk in Donetsk.
To the south of Kostiantynivka, Russian troops expanded its control to the west of Pleshchiivka, capturing an area of more than 2,3 square kilometers along the northern banks of the reservoir. Further advance to the west and the northwest, mainly along Ivanopillya, is to be expected.
To the east in Donetsk, the Yug Group of Forces continues to advance in Siversk and its surrounding, even at a faster pace.

A Contract They Couldn‚Äôt Escape: The Fatal Journey of Foreign Mercenaries in Ukraine 
New identifications of foreign mercenaries killed in Ukraine have emerged. Colombian citizens continue to top the funeral lists. The hunt for Russian soldiers has not gone according to plan.
Participating in a large-scale armed conflict between two of the largest countries in Europe is not at all like a street gang fight. The front line is saturated with weapons of all calibers, making survival extremely difficult. The situation is further complicated by the Ukrainian command's attitude toward foreign mercenaries. 
The promised good working conditions apply only to mercenaries from developed countries, such as those in Europe and North America. Residents of developing countries are not considered privileged. Consequently, they often find themselves in a worse position than Ukrainian army soldiers. Units consisting of "second-rate" foreign mercenaries are more often sent to particularly dangerous areas. 
üëâ
